attributes.action: Ensure Bournemouth Council retains a weekly small wheelie bin collection service
attributes.additional_details: The ramifications of this change to the rubbish collection service will mean that increased refuse sacks will be left around homes for a week; increasing the vermin population.  In addition, the collection service today does not take extra black refuse sacks which are put next to the smaller wheelie bin on the weekly service; therefore increasing piles of rubbish will build up along streets creating a public health hazard.
attributes.background: Bournemouth Council are reportedly looking to move the weekly rubbish collections for residents to fortnightly whilst still retaining a weekly 23 ltr food caddy collection.  For the majority of families and multiple occupancy homes fortnightly is not enough.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here:
